modes.name: Builder
modes.definition: Turns intention into infrastructure and repeatable outcomes.

modes.name: Visionary
modes.definition: Orients the system toward meaning and future direction.

modes.name: Regulator
modes.definition: Protects integrity and stability through boundaries and standards.

modes.name: Transformer
modes.definition: Reinvents form; turns pressure into growth through transmutation.

subtypes.name: System Builder
subtypes.title: Architect — System Builder
subtypes.description: Architect — System Builder is the Architect core expressed through the Builder execution mode. At its best, it builds durable frameworks that outlast moods and builds infrastructure. In shadow, it trends toward rigidity, control, confusing structure with truth plus the builder failure pattern of workaholic control. Integration: trade certainty for iteration; keep systems human; add vision checkpoints so you don't build the wrong cathedral.

integration_keys: trade certainty for iteration; keep systems human
add vision checkpoints so you don't build the wrong cathedral

watch_out_for: Unintegrated versions of your polarity opposite
People who demand you shrink to keep their comfort
Environments that reward chaos with attention

stack_overlay_notes: Light Stack = ranks 1,2,5,6 (white). Shadow Stack = ranks 3,4,7,8 (black).
Dots = lesser pair inside each stack.

subtypes.name: Disruptive Igniter
subtypes.title: Catalyst — Disruptive Igniter
subtypes.description: Catalyst — Disruptive Igniter is the Catalyst core expressed through the Builder execution mode. At its best, it forces evolution when stagnation becomes lethal and builds infrastructure. In shadow, it trends toward collateral damage, intensity addiction, scorched-earth escalation plus the builder failure pattern of workaholic control. Integration: aim the fire; use containers; recover on purpose; add vision checkpoints so you don't build the wrong cathedral.

required_inputs.name: core_rankings
required_inputs.note: Ranked core NAMES from highest(1) to lowest(8). Must use canonical names.
